duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and manage an HR team of 10 people, including safety and training.
Strategically partner with the President and local leadership team to develop, implement, and coordinate human resources practices.
Evaluate and plan for competitive and equitable salary and benefit administration for all employees.
Collaborate with key leaders on strategic human resource planning and talent acquisition.
Establish and track key HR performance indicators to ensure contributions to operational objectives.
Ensure compliance with all relevant state and federal laws regarding employment, EEO, ERISA, record retention, etc.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Relations, Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field (SPHR certification preferred). Minimum ten years’ experience including progressive management and HR generalist backgrounds in a manufacturing environment. Strong leadership, teamwork, change management and program management skills.
